channel.title: 4. Deploy ML models on Getting Started with Amazon SageMaker Studio
channel.description: Recent content in 4. Deploy ML models on Getting Started with Amazon SageMaker Studio

item.title: 4.1 Deploy XGBoost model
item.description: Start this section in a new Jupyter notebook with the Data Science kernel Import necessary packages import json import time import s3fs import boto3 import pandas as pd import sagemaker from sagemaker.s3 import S3Downloader from sagemaker.model_monitor.dataset_format import DatasetFormat from sagemaker.model_monitor import DataCaptureConfig, DefaultModelMonitor# Set region, boto3 and SageMaker SDK variablesÂ¶ #You can change this to a region of your choice region = sagemaker.Session().boto_region_name print("Using AWS Region: {}".format(region)) boto3.setup_default_session(region_name=region) boto_session = boto3.
